alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 23 at 3:50PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW POSSIBLE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE... Confidence is increasing in the potential for accumulating snow across the northern panhandle late Tuesday night into Wednesday. The best chance for accumulating snow at sea level is over Haines and Skagway. Along the Icy Strait corridor, including Hoonah, Gustavus and Juneau, snow mixed with rain, but little to no accumulation. As the storm system lifts northward Wednesday, expect a changeover from a mix of rain and snow to rain for the Icy Strait corridor early to mid Wednesday morning with Haines and Skagway changing over mid to late afternoon. Higher elevations along the Klondike highway could see more significant accumulations through Wednesday night. Continue to check weather.gov/juneau for the latest forecasts updates.
